avalancheActivity.comment: Danger of small (where snow is sufficient, medium-sized) glide-snow avalanches on steep grass-covered or rocky slopes still threatens. Caution urged below glide cracks. Otherwise, avalanche danger is low. Small wet loose-snow avalanches are possible on sunny extrmely steep slopes. Isolated avalanche triggerings by winter sports enthusiasts are possible in extremely steep terrain.  Apart from the danger of being buried in snow masses, the risks of being swept along and forced to take a fall require adequate consideration.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Attention: gliding snow. Otherwise favourable conditions.

snowpackStructure.comment: The below-average snowpack is well consolidated by and large. In high altitude pass and ridgeline zones, small fresh, often trigger-sensitive snowdrift accumulations require attentiveness. Esp. on steep shady slopes these drifts have been deposited atop loose snow and are prone to triggering. High-altitude shady slopes are often still powdery, elsewhere the snowpack is often with breakable crusts, sometimes wind crusts are capable of bearing loads. On sunny slopes, a melt-freeze crust. During the daytime hours, this crust softens up again. In recent days increasingly frequent fresh glide cracks and glide-snow avalanches have been reported.

tendency.highlights: Avalanche danger levels not expected to change significantly

weatherForecast.comment: In the wake of nocturnal perturbances, visibility in early morning will rapidly improve, residual clouds and fogbanks will disperse, then a few hours of pleasant weather will follow. As of midday, high-altitude cloudbanks will move in from the west. Still relatively mild at high altitudes.  At 2000m: -3 to +1 degree. Light westerly winds, intensifying in the evening.

avalancheActivity.comment: In high-altitude ridgeline and pass areas, small drifted massed need attentiveness from place to place, they are on occasion prone to triggering. Apart from the danger of being buried in snow masses, the risks of being swept along and forced to take a fall require adequate consideration. Danger of small (where snow is sufficient, medium-sized) glide-snow avalanches on steep grass-covered or rocky slopes still threatens. Caution urged below glide cracks. Small wet loose-snow avalanches are possible on sunny extrmely steep slopes.

Esp. on steep shady slopes these drifts have been deposited atop loose snow and are prone to triggering. High-altitude shady slopes are often still powdery, elsewhere the snowpack is often with breakable crusts, sometimes wind crusts are capable of bearing loads. On sunny slopes, a melt-freeze crust. During the daytime hours, this crust softens up again. In recent days increasingly frequent fresh glide cracks and glide-snow avalanches have been reported.

As of midday, high-altitude cloudbanks will move in from the west. Still relatively mild at high altitudes.  At 2000m: -3 to +1 degree. Light westerly winds, intensifying in the evening.

customData.generalHeadline: Favorable conditions: predominantly low avalanche danger
